ground_truth: She fixes him a glass of tea while he is looking around, then hands him the tea. He picks up his hat and goes out, and she looks after him. Neff bangs the front door shut, walks quickly to his car, and drives away. Shooting past Neff sitting behind the wheel of his car, the car hop hangs a tray on the door and serves him a bottle of beer. Neff goes bowling and rolls the ball with an effort at concentration, but his mind is not really on the game. It is a six-story building in the Normandie-Wilshire district, with a basement garage. The camera pans up the front of the building to the top-floor windows as a little rain starts to fall. Neff stands by the window with his coat off and his tie loose, while raindrops strike against the glass. He turns away impatiently, paces up and down past a caddy bag with golf clubs in it, pulls one out at random, makes a couple of short swings, throws the club on the couch, and paces again. Neff goes to the door and opens it, and then just looks at her. She has nothing in her hands but her bag, and he looks down at her hands. She comes in, and he closes the door. Neff switches on the standing lamp, and she starts to take off her coat. He takes her coat and lays it across the back of a chair as Phyllis has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet window-pane. By this time, he has hold of her wrist, draws her to him slowly, and kisses her. Her arms tighten around him. After a moment, he pulls his head back, still holding her close. He lets her go and moves toward the dinette, which contains a small table and some chairs. A low glass-and-china cabinet is built between the dinette and kitchen, leaving a space like a doorway. The kitchen is the usual apartment house kitchen, with a stove, ice-box, sink, etc., and it is quite small. Neff goes to the ice-box and Phyllis drifts in after him. He points at the china closet and has taken a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator, holding it under the hot-water faucet. Phyllis has the glasses now and hands them to him. He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses, reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet, and hands her a glass. They move back toward the living room, where Phyllis and Neff go toward the davenport and sit on it, fairly close together. He puts his arms around her, kisses her, and holds her tight, their heads touching side by side, as the camera slowly starts to recede.

A low glass-and-china cabinet is constructed between the dinette and kitchen, leaving an area like a doorway. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She prepares him a glass of tea while he looks around, then hands it to him. He picks up his hat, leaves, and she watches him go. Neff shuts the front door, quickly heads to his car, and drives off. A car hop serves him a beer on a tray. Neff goes bowling, but his mind isn't on the game. The building is six stories in the Normandie-Wilshire district, with a basement garage. The camera pans up to the top-floor windows as rain begins. Neff stands by the window, coat off, tie loose, as raindrops hit the glass. He turns away, paces, swings a golf club, throws it on the couch, and paces again. Neff opens the door and looks at her. She enters, and he closes the door. Neff turns on a lamp as she removes her coat. He takes it and places it on a chair. Phyllis moves to the window, staring out. He holds her wrist, draws her in, and kisses her. Her arms tighten around him. He pulls back, still holding her, then moves to the dinette. A glass-and-china cabinet separates the dinette and kitchen. Neff goes to the ice-box, and Phyllis follows. He points at the china closet, takes ice cubes from the refrigerator, and holds them under hot water. Phyllis hands him glasses. He adds ice, grabs the whiskey bottle, and gives her a glass. They return to the living room, sit on the davenport, and he embraces her, their heads touching as the camera slowly recedes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She prepares him a glass of tea, hands it to him, and he leaves with his hat. Neff shuts the door, quickly heads to his car, and drives off. A car hop serves him beer as he sits in his car. Neff bowls but is distracted. The camera pans a six-story building in the Normandie-Wilshire district as rain falls. Neff, coat off and tie loose, paces by the window, swings a golf club, and paces again. He opens the door to her, she enters, and he closes it. Neff turns on a lamp, takes her coat, and she looks out the window. He holds her wrist, kisses her, and they embrace. He moves to the dinette, pointing at the china closet, and takes ice cubes from the fridge. Phyllis hands him glasses, he adds ice, grabs whiskey, and gives her a glass. They sit on the davenport, embrace, and kiss as the camera recedes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
While he is busy looking around, she takes the time to prepare a glass of tea for him. Once the tea is ready, she hands it to him with a gentle gesture. After accepting the tea, he picks up his hat and makes his way out, while she watches him leave with a lingering gaze. Neff, on the other hand, bangs the front door shut with a sense of urgency, quickly strides to his car, and drives away with determination. As the scene shifts, we see Neff sitting behind the wheel of his car, and a car hop approaches, hanging a tray on the car door and serving him a bottle of beer. Neff then heads to the bowling alley, where he attempts to focus on rolling the ball down the lane, but his mind is clearly elsewhere, not fully engaged in the game.

The setting transitions to a six-story building located in the Normandie-Wilshire district, complete with a basement garage. The camera gracefully pans up the front of the building, capturing the top-floor windows just as a light rain begins to fall. Inside, Neff stands by the window, having removed his coat and loosened his tie, while raindrops patter against the glass. Feeling restless, he turns away from the window with impatience, pacing back and forth past a caddy bag filled with golf clubs. He randomly selects a club, makes a couple of short practice swings, then tosses the club onto the couch and resumes his pacing.

Neff approaches the door and opens it, pausing to simply look at her. She stands there with nothing in her hands except her bag, and he glances down at her hands. She steps inside, and he closes the door behind her. Neff switches on the standing lamp, casting a warm glow in the room, as she begins to remove her coat. He takes her coat from her and carefully lays it across the back of a chair. Meanwhile, Phyllis has moved over to the window, gazing out through the rain-speckled pane. By this time, Neff has gently taken hold of her wrist, drawing her toward him slowly, and they share a kiss. Her arms wrap tightly around him, and after a moment, he pulls his head back, still holding her close.

He releases her and moves toward the dinette area, which features a small table and some chairs. A low glass-and-china cabinet is built between the dinette and the kitchen, creating a space reminiscent of a doorway. The kitchen itself is typical of an apartment house, equipped with a stove, ice-box, sink, and other essentials, and it is quite compact. Neff heads to the ice-box, and Phyllis follows him into the kitchen. He gestures toward the china closet and retrieves a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator, holding it under the hot-water faucet to loosen the cubes. Phyllis now has the glasses in her hands and passes them to him. He drops some ice cubes into the glasses, reaches for the whiskey bottle perched on top of the china closet, and hands her a glass. Together, they move back toward the living room, where Phyllis and Neff head to the davenport and sit closely together. He wraps his arms around her, kisses her, and holds her tightly, their heads resting side by side, as the camera slowly begins to pull away, capturing the intimate moment.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As he remains engrossed in exploring his surroundings, she takes advantage of this moment to thoughtfully prepare a steaming glass of tea just for him. Once the tea is ready, she presents it to him with a gentle and graceful gesture. Upon accepting the warm beverage, he takes up his hat and heads towards the door, making his exit. She watches him depart with a lingering and thoughtful gaze. Meanwhile, Neff, filled with urgency, forcefully shuts the front door behind him. With brisk strides, he makes his way to his car, driving away with a sense of determination evident in his actions. As the scene shifts seamlessly, we find Neff seated behind the steering wheel of his vehicle. A car hop approaches and expertly hangs a tray on the car door, serving him a bottle of cold beer. Neff then proceeds to the bowling alley, intent on focusing his attention on rolling the ball smoothly down the lane. However, it becomes evident that his mind is preoccupied, not fully engaged with the activity at hand.

The setting then transitions to reveal a six-story building situated in the Normandie-Wilshire district, complete with a basement garage. The camera gracefully pans up the façade of the building, capturing the top-floor windows just as a gentle rain begins to fall. Inside the building, Neff stands near the window, having already removed his coat and loosened his tie, while raindrops create a soft rhythm against the glass. Feeling a sense of restlessness, he turns away from the window with visible impatience, pacing back and forth past a golf caddy bag filled with clubs. He randomly selects a club, makes a couple of short practice swings, quickly tosses the club onto the couch, and resumes his pacing.

Neff approaches the door and opens it, pausing momentarily to simply observe her. She stands quietly in front of him, holding nothing except her bag, and he allows his gaze to drift down to her hands. She steps into the room, and he gently closes the door behind her. Neff reaches over to switch on the standing lamp, casting a soft and warm glow throughout the room, as she begins to remove her coat. He graciously takes her coat from her, carefully draping it over the back of a nearby chair. Meanwhile, Phyllis has moved over to the window, gazing quietly out through the rain-speckled glass pane. By this time, Neff has gently taken hold of her wrist, drawing her toward him with a slow and deliberate motion, leading to a shared kiss. Her arms wrap tightly around him, and after a few moments, he gently pulls his head back, still holding her close with affection.

He releases her from his embrace and moves toward the dinette area, which features a small table along with several chairs. A low glass-and-china cabinet is built between the dinette and the kitchen, creating a space that resembles a doorway. The kitchen itself is typical of one found in an apartment house, equipped with a stove, an ice-box, a sink, and other essentials, all within a compact area. Neff heads to the ice-box, with Phyllis following him into the kitchen. He makes a gesture toward the china closet and retrieves a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator, holding it under the hot-water faucet to loosen the chilled cubes. Phyllis now holds the glasses in her hands and passes them to him. He drops a few ice cubes into each glass, reaches for the whiskey bottle that rests atop the china closet, and hands her a glass. Together, they make their way back toward the inviting living room, where Phyllis and Neff head to the davenport, sitting closely together in a warm embrace. He wraps his arms warmly around her, sharing a tender kiss while holding her tightly, their heads resting side by side, as the camera slowly begins to pull away, capturing the intimate and tender moment between them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She carefully prepares a glass of tea for him, her hands moving with practiced ease as she measures and pours, all while he is occupied with scanning the room, his eyes taking in every detail. Once the tea is ready, she extends her arm to offer it to him, and he accepts it with a nod of thanks. He then reaches for his hat, lifting it with a casual motion, and heads toward the door. As he steps outside, she watches him leave, her gaze lingering on his retreating figure. Neff, now outside, forcefully closes the front door behind him, the sound echoing in the quiet, and strides purposefully to his car. He gets in, starts the engine, and drives away with determination. As the scene shifts, a car hop approaches Neff, who is seated behind the wheel of his car, and deftly hangs a tray on the car door, serving him a bottle of beer with a practiced efficiency. Neff then finds himself at a bowling alley, where he picks up a bowling ball, his fingers fitting into the holes as he attempts to focus on the game. He rolls the ball down the lane, but his thoughts are elsewhere, his concentration wavering. The setting changes to a six-story building in the Normandie-Wilshire district, complete with a basement garage. The camera smoothly pans up the building's facade, capturing the top-floor windows just as a light rain begins to fall. Inside, Neff stands by the window, his coat removed and his tie loosened, as he listens to the raindrops tapping against the glass. Feeling restless, he turns away from the window, pacing back and forth past a caddy bag filled with golf clubs. He randomly selects a club, swings it a couple of times in short arcs, then tosses it onto the couch in frustration before resuming his pacing. Neff approaches the door, opens it, and pauses to look at her standing there. She holds nothing but her bag, and his eyes drift down to her hands. She steps inside, and he closes the door behind her. Neff flicks on the standing lamp, casting a warm glow over the room, as she begins to remove her coat. He takes her coat from her, carefully draping it over the back of a chair, while Phyllis moves to the window, gazing out at the rain-splattered pane. By now, Neff has gently taken hold of her wrist, drawing her toward him with a slow, deliberate motion, and kisses her softly. Her arms encircle him, pulling him closer. After a moment, he pulls back slightly, still holding her close, before releasing her and moving toward the dinette area, which features a small table and several chairs. A low glass-and-china cabinet separates the dinette from the kitchen, creating a doorway-like space. The kitchen itself is a typical apartment kitchen, compact and functional, with a stove, ice-box, and sink. Neff heads to the ice-box, and Phyllis follows him in. He gestures toward the china closet and retrieves a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator, holding it under the hot-water faucet to loosen the cubes. Phyllis now has the glasses in hand and passes them to him. He drops a few ice cubes into each glass, then reaches for the whiskey bottle perched atop the china closet, pouring a measure into each glass before handing one to her. Together, they return to the living room, where they make their way to the davenport and sit down, their bodies close. Neff wraps his arm around her, drawing her in for a kiss, holding her tightly as their heads rest side by side, and the camera slowly pulls back, capturing the intimate moment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She prepares a glass of tea for him, hands it over, and watches as he leaves with his hat. Neff exits, shuts the door, quickly reaches his car, and drives off. At a drive-in, a car hop serves him a beer. Neff attempts to focus on bowling, but his mind wanders. The scene shifts to a six-story building in the Normandie-Wilshire district, where rain begins to fall. Neff, with his coat off and tie loosened, stands by the window, paces, swings a golf club, and then discards it. He opens the door for her, noting her empty hands, and she enters. After closing the door, Neff turns on a lamp as she removes her coat, which he places on a chair. She gazes out the window, and he draws her close for a kiss. They embrace, then he moves to the dinette area. In the small kitchen, he retrieves ice cubes, and she follows, handing him glasses. He adds ice, grabs a whiskey bottle, and gives her a glass. They return to the living room, sit closely on the davenport, and share a kiss, holding each other as the camera slowly pulls away.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She fixes him a glass of tea while he is looking around, taking in the warm and inviting decor typical of a 1940s suburban living room, then hands him the tea. He picks up his hat, a classic fedora that was popular during that era, and goes out, and she looks after him. Neff bangs the front door shut, walks quickly to his car, a sleek 1938 Plymouth Coupe, and drives away. Shooting past Neff sitting behind the wheel of his car, the car hop, a staple of drive-in diners that became widespread in the mid-20th century, hangs a tray on the door and serves him a bottle of cold beer. Neff goes bowling at the local alley, known for its retro charm with wooden lanes and manual scorekeeping, and rolls the ball with an effort at concentration, but his mind is not really on the game. It is a six-story building from the Art Deco period in the bustling Normandie-Wilshire district of Los Angeles, known for its blend of historical and modern architecture, with a basement garage. The camera pans up the front of the building to the top-floor windows as a little rain starts to fall, a rare yet refreshing occurrence in Southern California's typically dry climate. Neff stands by the window with his coat off and his tie loose, while raindrops strike against the glass, producing a rhythmic, calming sound. He turns away impatiently, paces up and down past a caddy bag with golf clubs in it, pulls one out at random, makes a couple of short swings in a manner reminiscent of practiced golfers, throws the club on the couch, and paces again. Neff goes to the door and opens it, and then just looks at her. She has nothing in her hands but her bag, a stylish accessory reflecting her fashionable taste, and he looks down at her hands. She comes in, and he closes the door. Neff switches on the standing lamp, casting a soft, ambient glow, and she starts to take off her coat. He takes her coat and lays it across the back of a chair as Phyllis has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet window-pane, lost in thought. By this time, he has hold of her wrist, draws her to him slowly, and kisses her. Her arms tighten around him in a gesture of deep affection. After a moment, he pulls his head back, still holding her close. He lets her go and moves toward the dinette, which contains a small table and some chairs, creating a cozy nook for meals. A low glass-and-china cabinet is built between the dinette and kitchen, leaving a space like a doorway that blends both areas seamlessly. The kitchen is the usual apartment house kitchen of the era, with a stove, ice-box, sink, etc., and it is quite small, maximizing efficiency in limited space. Neff goes to the ice-box and Phyllis drifts in after him. He points at the china closet, its shelves filled with delicate heirloom dishes, and has taken a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator, holding it under the hot-water faucet to loosen them. Phyllis has the glasses now and hands them to him. He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses, reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet, and hands her a glass. They move back toward the living room, where Phyllis and Neff go toward the davenport—an elegant term for sofa, common in earlier decades—and sit on it, fairly close together. He puts his arms around her, kisses her, and holds her tight, their heads touching side by side, as the camera slowly starts to recede, echoing the fading tension of the moment.

He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet and hands her a glass. They move back toward the living room where Phyllis and Neff go toward the davenport and sit on it fairly close together. He puts his arms around her kisses her and holds her tight their heads touching side by side as the camera slowly starts to recede.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: She fixes him a glass of tea while he is looking around then hands him the tea. He picks up his hat and goes out and she looks after him. Neff bangs the front door shut walks quickly to his car and drives away. Shooting past Neff sitting behind the wheel of his car the car hop hangs a tray on the door and serves him a bottle of beer. Neff goes bowling and rolls the ball with an effort at concentration but his mind is not really on the game. It is a sixstory building in the NormandieWilshire district with a basement garage. The camera pans up the front of the building to the topfloor windows as a little rain starts to fall. Neff stands by the window with his coat off and his tie loose while raindrops strike against the glass. He turns away impatiently paces up and down past a caddy bag with golf clubs in it pulls one out at random makes a couple of short swings throws the club on the couch and paces again. Neff goes to the door and opens it and then just looks at her. She has nothing in her hands but her bag and he looks down at her hands. She comes in and he closes the door. Neff switches on the standing lamp and she starts to take off her coat. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. He takes her coat and lays it across the back of a chair as Phyllis has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet windowpane. By this time he has hold of her wrist draws her to him slowly and kisses her. Her arms tighten around him. After a moment he pulls his head back still holding her close. He let us her go and moves toward the dinette which contains a small table and some chairs. A low glassandchina cabinet is built between the dinette and kitchen leaving a space like a doorway. The kitchen is the usual apartment house kitchen with a stove icebox sink etc and it is quite small. Neff goes to the icebox and Phyllis drifts in after him. He points at the china closet and has taken a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator holding it under the hotwater faucet. Phyllis has the glasses now and hands them to him. He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet and hands her a glass. They move back toward the living room where Phyllis and Neff go toward the davenport and sit on it fairly close together. He puts his arms around her kisses her and holds her tight their heads touching side by side as the camera slowly starts to recede.

test_cases.description: She fixes him a glass of tea while he is looking around then hands him the tea. He picks up his hat and goes out and she looks after him. Neff bangs the front door shut walks quickly to his car and drives away. He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet and hands her a glass. They move back toward the living room where Phyllis and Neff go toward the davenport and sit on it fairly close together. He puts his arms around her kisses her and holds her tight their heads touching side by side as the camera slowly starts to recede.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The dog fixes the cat a glass of tea while the cat is looking around, then hands the cat the tea. The cat picks up its hat and goes out, and the dog looks after the cat. The elephant bangs the front door shut, walks quickly to its car, and drives away. Shooting past the elephant sitting behind the wheel of its car, the car hop hangs a tray on the door and serves the elephant a bottle of beer. The elephant goes bowling and rolls the ball with an effort at concentration, but its mind is not really on the game. It is a six-story building in the Normandie-Wilshire district, with a basement garage. The camera pans up the front of the building to the top-floor windows as a little rain starts to fall. The elephant stands by the window with its coat off and its tie loose, while raindrops strike against the glass. The elephant turns away impatiently, paces up and down past a caddy bag with golf clubs in it, pulls one out at random, makes a couple of short swings, throws the club on the couch, and paces again. The elephant goes to the door and opens it, and then just looks at the rabbit. The rabbit has nothing in its hands but its bag, and the elephant looks down at its hands. The rabbit comes in, and the elephant closes the door. The elephant switches on the standing lamp, and the rabbit starts to take off its coat. The elephant takes its coat and lays it across the back of a chair as the giraffe has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet window-pane. By this time, the elephant has hold of the giraffe's wrist, draws the giraffe to it slowly, and kisses the giraffe. The giraffe's arms tighten around the elephant. After a moment, the elephant pulls its head back, still holding the giraffe close. The elephant lets go of the giraffe and moves toward the dinette, which contains a small table and some chairs. A low glass-and-china cabinet is built between the dinette and kitchen, leaving a space like a doorway. The kitchen is the usual apartment house kitchen, with a stove, ice-box, sink, etc., and it is quite small. The elephant goes to the ice-box and the giraffe drifts in after it. The elephant points at the china closet and has taken a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator, holding it under the hot-water faucet. The giraffe has the glasses now and hands them to the elephant. The elephant dumps some ice cubes into the glasses, reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet, and hands the giraffe a glass. They move back toward the living room, where the giraffe and the elephant go toward the davenport and sit on it, fairly close together. The elephant puts its arms around the giraffe, kisses the giraffe, and holds the giraffe tight, their heads touching side by side, as the camera slowly starts to recede.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She fixes him a mug of lemonade while he is looking around, then hands him the lemonade. He picks up his scarf and goes out, and she looks after him. Neff bangs the garden gate shut, walks quickly to his scooter, and rides away. Shooting past Neff sitting behind the handlebar of his scooter, the server hangs a platter on the handle and serves him a cup of coffee. Neff goes golfing and swings the club with an effort at concentration, but his mind is not really on the game. It is a four-story factory in the Bellevue-Piccadilly district, with a rooftop terrace. The camera pans up the front of the factory to the top-floor windows as a light drizzle starts to fall. Neff stands by the window with his jacket off and his belt loose, while raindrops strike against the glass. He turns away impatiently, paces up and down past a baseball bag with bats in it, pulls one out at random, makes a couple of short swings, throws the bat on the armchair, and paces again. Neff goes to the door and opens it, and then just looks at her. She has nothing in her hands but her umbrella, and he looks down at her hands. She comes in, and he closes the door. Neff switches on the wall lamp, and she starts to take off her shawl. He takes her shawl and lays it across the back of a recliner as Phyllis has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet glass pane. By this time, he has hold of her elbow, draws her to him slowly, and kisses her. Her arms tighten around him. After a moment, he pulls his head back, still holding her close. He lets her go and moves toward the study, which contains a small desk and some stools. A low book-and-plastic cabinet is built between the study and pantry, leaving a space like a doorway. The pantry is the usual apartment house pantry, with a microwave, freezer, sink, etc., and it is quite small. Neff goes to the freezer and Phyllis drifts in after him. He points at the bookcase and has taken a tray of lemon slices from the freezer, holding it under the cold-water faucet. Phyllis has the mugs now and hands them to him. He dumps some lemon slices into the mugs, reaches for the juice bottle on top of the bookcase, and hands her a mug. They move back toward the drawing room, where Phyllis and Neff go toward the settee and sit on it, fairly close together. He puts his arms around her, kisses her, and holds her tight, their heads touching side by side, as the camera slowly starts to recede.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She prepares him a bowl of soup while he is glancing around, then tosses him the soup. He grabs his coat and strolls out, and she waves after him. Neff slams the front door shut, jogs quickly to his car, and pedals away. Zooming past Neff lounging behind the wheel of his car, the car hop sets a tray on the door and hands him a soda. Neff goes to the cinema and watches the screen with an effort at focus, but his mind is not really on the film. It is a six-story building in the Normandie-Wilshire district, with a rooftop terrace. The camera tilts up the facade of the building to the top-floor windows as a soft drizzle starts to fall. Neff stands by the window with his shirt untucked and his shoes off, while raindrops tap against the glass. He turns away abruptly, strides up and down past a bookshelf with novels in it, plucks one out at random, reads a couple of pages, tosses the book on the couch, and strides again. Neff goes to the door and shuts it, and then just listens to her. She has nothing in her hands but her scarf, and he glances at her scarf. She steps in, and he opens the door. Neff dims the standing lamp, and she starts to adjust her scarf. He takes her scarf and hangs it across the back of a chair as Phyllis has moved over to the window and gazes out through the misty window-pane. By this time, he has hold of her elbow, nudges her to him gently, and whispers to her. Her fingers tap on his back. After a moment, he tilts his head back, still holding her close. He releases her and moves toward the bookshelves, which contain a small bookshelf and some picture frames. A low curtain divider is drawn between the bookshelves and kitchen, leaving a space like a passage. The kitchen is the usual apartment house kitchen, with a microwave, dishwasher, sink, etc., and it is quite compact. Neff goes to the microwave and Phyllis glides in after him. He gestures at the curtain divider and has taken a dish towel from the counter, holding it under the cold-water faucet. Phyllis has the coasters now and passes them to him. He plops some coasters onto the table, reaches for the lemonade bottle on top of the curtain divider, and hands her a coaster. They drift back toward the living room, where Phyllis and Neff go toward the armchair and scoot onto it, fairly close together. He wraps his arms around her, whispers in her ear, and holds her close, their heads leaning side by side, as the camera slowly starts to zoom out.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The ceiling repairs a bottle of lemonade while the bicycle is inspecting the area, then passes the lemonade to the bicycle. The bicycle picks up its umbrella and heads outside, and the ceiling observes the departure. The doorknob slams the back gate shut, strides briskly to its scooter, and rides off. Gliding past the doorknob seated behind the handlebars of its scooter, the curtain rings a bell on the frame and offers it a cup of juice. The doorknob goes kayaking and paddles with an attempt at focus, but its thoughts are not truly on the activity. It is a four-story sculpture in the Atlantis-Piccadilly zone, with an attic loft. The microphone sweeps up the facade of the sculpture to the attic windows as a gentle snow starts to drift. The doorknob stands by the window with its scarf off and its belt undone, while snowflakes tap against the glass. It pivots away irritably, strides up and down past a wheelbarrow filled with tennis rackets, pulls one out at random, makes a few light swings, tosses the racket on the hammock, and strides again. The doorknob approaches the gate and unlocks it, and then simply gazes at the chandelier. The chandelier holds nothing but an envelope, and the doorknob glances at its contents. The chandelier enters, and the doorknob shuts the gate. The doorknob flicks on the wall sconce, and the chandelier begins to take off its jacket. The doorknob takes the jacket and drapes it across the back of a loveseat as the starling has moved over to the bay window and peers out through the frosty pane. By this moment, it grasps its ankle, draws it nearer, and embraces it. Its feet clasp around it. After a pause, it retracts its face, still clutching it closely. It releases it and advances toward the sunroom, which holds a low stool and some cushions. A high mirror-and-wood shelf is constructed between the sunroom and pantry, creating an opening like a gateway. The pantry is the typical townhouse pantry, with a microwave, cooler, basin, etc., and it is rather compact. The doorknob proceeds to the cooler and the starling floats in after it. It gestures at the wood shelf and has taken a platter of chocolate bars from the cooler, running it under the cold-water tap. The starling has the mugs now and gives them to it. It drops some chocolate bars into the mugs, reaches for the lemonade pitcher on top of the wood shelf, and hands the starling a mug. They drift back toward the conservatory, where the starling and the doorknob head toward the daybed and settle on it, reasonably close together. It wraps its wings around it, embraces it, and hugs it securely, their faces side by side, as the microphone gently begins to withdraw.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat brews him a cup of milk while he is roaming around, then passes him the milk. He gathers his scarf and heads out, and the cat watches after him. Moore slams the front door shut, saunters briskly to his bicycle, and pedals away. Skidding past Moore sitting atop the saddle of his bicycle, the waiter places a tray on the handlebars and serves him a bottle of soda. Moore goes skiing and slides down the slope with an attempt at focus, but his mind is not truly on the sport. It is a four-story house in the Belmont-Venice district, with a rooftop terrace. The lens sweeps up the facade of the house to the attic windows as a light drizzle begins to fall. Moore leans by the window with his jacket off and his belt unbuckled, while raindrops tap against the glass. He turns around restlessly, strides up and down past a shelf with books in it, pulls one out at random, flips through a couple of pages, tosses the book on the couch, and strides again. Moore approaches the window and unlatches it, and then just stares at her. She has nothing in her pocket but a locket, and he glances down at her pocket. She steps inside, and he bolts the window. Moore flicks on the reading light, and she begins to remove her scarf. He takes her scarf and drapes it over the back of a stool as Clara has moved over to the window and gazes out through the misty window-pane. By now, he has grasped her necklace, pulls her to him gently, and embraces her. Her hands tighten around him. After a beat, he tilts his head back, still grasping her gently. He releases her and heads toward the kitchenette, which contains a small counter and some stools. A low wood-and-metal shelf is installed between the kitchenette and pantry, leaving a space like an archway. The pantry is the usual flat-style pantry, with a toaster, fridge, basin, etc., and it is rather cramped. Moore heads to the fridge and Clara floats in after him. He gestures at the metal rack and has drawn a bowl of fruits from the fridge, holding it over the cold-water spout. Clara has the saucers now and presents them to him. He tips some fruits into the saucers, reaches for the juice bottle on top of the metal rack, and hands her a saucer. They retreat toward the family room, where Clara and Moore approach the chaise and settle on it, quite snug together. He wraps his arms around her, hugs her, and cradles her tightly, their cheeks touching side by side, as the lens gradually begins to withdraw.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She prepares him a mug of milk while he is glancing around, then passes him the milk. He grabs his umbrella and steps outside, and she watches him leave. Neff slams the gate shut, strides quickly to his bicycle, and pedals away. Gliding past Neff perched on the seat of his bicycle, the attendant clips a basket to the handlebars and offers him a can of soda. Neff goes hiking and swings his arms with an effort at focus, but his attention is not really on the trail. It is a nine-story tower in the Beverly-Los Feliz area, with an upstairs gallery. The camera tilts up the side of the tower to the rooftop as a few flakes start to fall. Neff stands by the balcony with his jacket off and his scarf loose, while snowflakes tap against the glass. He turns away with frustration, wanders back and forth past a fishing rod holder with rods in it, pulls one out at random, makes a couple of tiny casts, tosses the rod on the sofa, and paces again. Neff goes to the entrance and pulls it open, and then just gazes at her. She carries nothing but her purse, and he glances down at her grip. She steps in, and he shuts the entrance. Neff flicks on the ceiling light, and she begins to remove her scarf. He takes her scarf and drapes it over the arm of a chair as Phyllis has wandered over to the balcony and gazes out through the damp glass. By this time, he has taken her elbow, pulls her to him slowly, and embraces her. Her arms wrap around him. After a moment, he leans his head back, still holding her closely. He releases her and heads toward the kitchenette, which features a compact table and some stools. A low glass-and-metal divider is built between the kitchenette and pantry, leaving a gap like a portal. The pantry is the usual apartment house pantry, with an oven, cooler, basin, etc., and it is quite cramped. Neff heads to the cooler and Phyllis floats in after him. He gestures at the divider and has taken a row of lemons from the pantry, holding it under the cold-water spout. Phyllis holds the mugs now and presents them to him. He drops a few lemon slices into the mugs, reaches for the gin bottle on top of the divider, and hands her a mug. They drift back toward the lounge, where Phyllis and Neff move toward the chaise longue and sit on it, fairly close together. He wraps his arms around her, kisses her, and holds her tightly, their heads resting side by side, as the camera slowly starts to pull away.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat constructs a tower of pancakes while the bear is nibbling on a map, then tosses him the pancakes. The bear grabs his umbrella and slips outside, and the cat hops around him. Finch slams the back gate open, strolls leisurely to his bicycle, and pedals away. Zipping past Finch balancing behind the handlebars of his bicycle, the waitress hooks a lantern on the handlebars and hands him a carton of lemonade. Finch visits a carnival and tosses the ring with an air of precision, but his heart is not really in the attraction. It is a three-story castle in the Atlantis-Oxford region, with an attic library. The camera zooms down the back of the castle to the basement doors as a few snowflakes start to flutter. Finch strolls by the door with his hat tossed aside and his belt undone, while snowflakes tap against the bricks. He turns around casually, strides up and down past a picnic basket with sandwiches in it, grabs one without looking, makes a couple of quick bites, drops the sandwich on the rug, and strides again. Finch walks to the window and slides it open, and then just gawks at the giraffe. She has nothing in her paws but her notebook, and he glances down at her paws. She bounces in, and he slides the window shut. Finch flicks on the ceiling fan, and she starts to peel off her scarf. He takes her scarf and drapes it over the back of a couch as Josephine has moved over to the mirror and gazes out through the frosty mirror-pane. By this hour, he has hold of her elbow, pulls her toward him gently, and hugs her. Her hands squeeze around him. After a beat, he nudges his head away, still keeping her close. He releases her and wanders toward the cupboard, which contains a large anchor and a few life vests. A tall bronze-and-pottery sculpture is stacked between the cupboard and arbor, leaving a gap like a window. The arbor is the typical communal area arbor, with a sundial, birdbath, bench, etc., and it is quite expansive. Finch waltzes to the birdbath and Josephine drifts out after him. He gestures at the sculpture and has snatched a bowl of honeycomb from the birdbath, holding it beneath the rainbow. Josephine has the teacups now and tosses them to him. He tosses some honeycomb into the teacups, reaches for the cola bottle atop the sculpture, and tosses her a teacup. They drift back toward the porch, where Josephine and Finch wander toward the hammock and lounge on it, fairly snug together. He wraps his wings around her, nuzzles her, and holds her gently, their eyes locked side by side, as the camera slowly starts to zoom out.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Neff receives a glass of tea before leaving, driving away quickly. At the bowling alley, his focus drifts. The scene shifts to a six-story building during rain. Neff, restless, practices swings with a golf club. Phyllis arrives; they kiss after she stares out the window. Moving to the dinette, Neff retrieves ice cubes while Phyllis fetches glasses. He pours whiskey, and they return to the living room, sitting closely on the davenport. Embraced, they kiss as the camera pulls back.

the NormandieWilshire district with a basement garage  A low glassandchina cabinet is built between the dinette and kitchen leaving a space like a doorway  Neff switches on the standing lamp and she starts to take off her coat  Neff bangs the front door shut walks quickly to his car and drives away  Shooting past Neff sitting behind the wheel of his car the car hop hangs a tray on the door and serves him a bottle of beer  He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet and hands her a glass  The camera pans up the front of the building to the topfloor windows as a little rain starts to fall  Neff goes bowling and rolls the ball with an effort at concentration but his mind is not really on the game  He turns away impatiently paces up and down past a caddy bag with golf clubs in it pulls one out at random makes a couple of short swings throws the club on the couch and paces again  She has nothing in her hands but her bag and he looks down at her hands  He takes her coat and lays it across the back of a chair as Phyllis has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet windowpane  Phyllis has the glasses now and hands them to him

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: He takes her coat and lays it across the back of a chair as Phyllis has moved over to the window and stares out through the wet windowpane  By this time he has hold of her wrist draws her to him slowly and kisses her  Her arms tighten around him  After a moment he pulls his head back still holding her close  He lets her go and moves toward the dinette which contains a small table and some chairs  A low glassandchina cabinet is built between the dinette and kitchen leaving a space like a doorway  The kitchen is the usual apartment house kitchen with a stove icebox sink etc and it is quite small  Neff goes to the icebox and Phyllis drifts in after him  He points at the china closet and has taken a tray of ice cubes from the refrigerator holding it under the hotwater faucet  Phyllis has the glasses now and hands them to him  He dumps some ice cubes into the glasses reaches for the whiskey bottle on top of the china closet and hands her a glass  They move back toward the living room where Phyllis and Neff go toward the davenport and sit on it fairly close together  He puts his arms around her kisses her and holds her tight their heads touching side by side as the camera slowly starts to recede She fixes him a glass of tea while he is looking around then hands him the tea  He picks up his hat and goes out and she looks after him  Neff bangs the front door shut walks quickly to his car and drives away  Shooting past Neff sitting behind the wheel of his car the car hop hangs a tray on the door and serves him a bottle of beer  Neff goes bowling and rolls the ball with an effort at concentration but his mind is not really on the game  It is a sixstory building in the NormandieWilshire district with a basement garage  The camera pans up the front of the building to the topfloor windows as a little rain starts to fall  Neff stands by the window with his coat off and his tie loose while raindrops strike against the glass  He turns away impatiently paces up and down past a caddy bag with golf clubs in it pulls one out at random makes a couple of short swings throws the club on the couch and paces again  Neff goes to the door and opens it and then just looks at her  She has nothing in her hands but her bag and he looks down at her hands  She comes in and he closes the door  Neff switches on the standing lamp and she starts to take off her coat
